words.definition: A branch of mathematics that deals with symbols and the rules for manipulating those symbols to solve equations.
words.example_sentence: She studied algebra to improve her problem-solving skills.

words.definition: A hot drink made from the roasted and ground seeds (coffee beans) of a tropical shrub.
words.example_sentence: He drank a cup of coffee to start his day.

words.definition: An expedition to observe or hunt animals in their natural habitat, especially in East Africa.
words.example_sentence: We went on a thrilling safari and saw many wild animals.

words.definition: A yellow, oval citrus fruit with a sour taste.
words.example_sentence: She squeezed fresh lemon juice into the drink.

words.definition: A type of bat with a round or oval frame strung with catgut, nylon, etc., used especially in tennis, badminton, and squash.
words.example_sentence: He swung the racket to hit the ball over the net.

words.definition: A colorless volatile flammable liquid that is produced by the natural fermentation of sugars and is the intoxicating constituent of wine, beer, spirits, and other drinks.
words.example_sentence: The bartender served us drinks containing alcohol.

words.definition: A wide-mouthed cylindrical container made of glass or pottery, typically with a lid.
words.example_sentence: I stored the cookies in a jar to keep them fresh.

words.definition: A danger or risk.
words.example_sentence: It's important to be aware of the hazards before starting a new activity.

words.definition: An object, typically an inscribed ring or stone, that is thought to have magic powers and to bring good luck.
words.example_sentence: He wore a talisman around his neck for protection.

words.definition: An orange-yellow spice obtained from the stigma of a crocus flower, used to flavor food and color dishes.
words.example_sentence: The recipe called for a pinch of saffron to enhance the flavor.

words.definition: A long upholstered seat with a back and arms, for two or more people.
words.example_sentence: They sat on the sofa and watched a movie together.

words.definition: The internal diameter or bore of a gun barrel.
words.example_sentence: The caliber of the gun determines the size of the ammunition it can fire.

words.definition: A North African dish consisting of meat, fish, or vegetables cooked slowly in a shallow earthenware cooking pot with a tall, cone-shaped lid.
words.example_sentence: The chef prepared a delicious tajine with chicken and vegetables.

words.definition: A dish consisting of a flat, round base of dough topped with tomato sauce, cheese, and various toppings, baked in an oven.
words.example_sentence: She ordered a large pizza with pepperoni and mushrooms.

words.definition: Used as a greeting or farewell.
words.example_sentence: He waved and said, 'Ciao!' as he left the room.

words.definition: A dish that typically consists of dough made from wheat flour and water, shaped or rolled into various forms, and cooked.
words.example_sentence: She cooked spaghetti pasta with a tomato sauce.

words.definition: An Italian style of ice cream, made with a base of milk, cream, and sugar, and flavored with various ingredients.
words.example_sentence: They enjoyed a scoop of delicious gelato on a hot summer day.

words.definition: A dramatic work in one or more acts, set to music and usually sung throughout.
words.example_sentence: They attended the opera and were captivated by the performances.

words.definition: A long, narrow boat used on the canals of Venice, typically propelled by a gondolier.
words.example_sentence: They took a romantic ride in a gondola through the canals of Venice.

words.definition: A painting done rapidly in watercolor on wet plaster on a wall or ceiling, so that the colors penetrate the plaster and become fixed as it dries.
words.example_sentence: They admired the beautiful frescoes on the walls of the ancient cathedral.

words.definition: A period of renewed interest and development in art, literature, and culture in Europe during the 14th to the 17th centuries.
words.example_sentence: The Renaissance brought about significant advancements in various fields of study.

words.definition: The highest singing voice in women and boys, with a bright and piercing tone.
words.example_sentence: She performed as a soprano in the opera and impressed the audience with her vocal range.

words.definition: A lively piece of music, typically free in form and featuring virtuosic display.
words.example_sentence: The pianist played a captivating capriccio that showcased their technical skills.

words.definition: In a quick and lively tempo.
words.example_sentence: The symphony started with a lively and energetic allegro movement.

words.definition: A complete failure or disaster.
words.example_sentence: The play turned out to be a fiasco with numerous technical difficulties.

words.definition: An Italian coffee drink made with espresso and hot milk, topped with frothed milk or whipped cream.
words.example_sentence: He ordered a cappuccino to enjoy with his breakfast.
